title: Add user-provided YouTube links to existing Video Lessons

requirements.summary: Set `videoUrl` for the first four existing video lessons using the user-provided YouTube URLs (trimmed for accidental whitespace) so the UI shows “Watch Video” and opens the correct links.
acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/content/videoLessons.ts`, the lessons with ids `speaking-confidence`, `youtube-getting-started`, `tiktok-getting-started`, and `presentation-skills` each have a non-empty `videoUrl` set to the corresponding provided YouTube link.
On the Video Lessons section UI, the four updated lessons show the “Watch Video” button (not the “Video link coming soon” message).
Clicking “Watch Video” on each of the four updated lessons opens the correct YouTube URL in a new tab/window.
Any user-facing text remains in English.

file_operations.description:
Update the existing `videoLessons` entries by setting `videoUrl` for the first four lessons in order (leaving remaining lessons unchanged):
- `speaking-confidence` -> `https://youtu.be/AYcqLymo6M4?si=oXI9wB5JR8c1UUur`
- `youtube-getting-started` -> `https://youtu.be/hvrLd5KKm0s?si=OZGyztKLlSUU6OkG` (remove the accidental whitespace between `?` and `si`)
- `tiktok-getting-started` -> `https://youtu.be/ICU-j1pItlA?si=TY7dOVpeQ7DIGCIh`
- `presentation-skills` -> `https://youtu.be/VNkaGh7wQt0?si=6TxjwpNIVev4u0wS`
Ensure the stored strings have no leading/trailing whitespace that could break the links.
